timeline.message: Add logs | tweak acceptable request rate

timeline.bodyText: On one hand I'd prefer not to add complexity - on the other I think we should special case a flat 0 for the request rate, because this is backed by an exponential metric registry and so an old, slow request might end up hanging for more than we would like.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText:
Could we make this 0.02?
The reason is because these endpoints on the AtlasDB side are autobatched. So the current p99 multiplier there means we'll say unhealthy on 50 seconds or above, and it would be good to catch a server that is queueing up 40 second autobatcher calls.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,15 +34,17 @@ private Constants() {
     public static final ServiceLevelObjectiveSpecification LEADER_TIME_SERVICE_LEVEL_OBJECTIVES
             = ServiceLevelObjectiveSpecification.builder()
             .maximumPermittedP99(Duration.ofMillis(200))
-            .minimumRequestRateForConsideration(1)
+            .minimumRequestRateForConsideration(0.1)
             .maximumPermittedErrorProportion(0.5)
+            .p99Multiplier(100)
             .build();
 
     public static final ServiceLevelObjectiveSpecification START_TRANSACTION_SERVICE_LEVEL_OBJECTIVES
             = ServiceLevelObjectiveSpecification.builder()
             .maximumPermittedP99(Duration.ofMillis(500))
-            .minimumRequestRateForConsideration(1)
+            .minimumRequestRateForConsideration(0.1)

timeline.bodyText:
I'd prefer a design where we have something like
  Duration maximumPermittedSteadyStateP99();
  Duration maximumPermittedQuietP99(); // currently this is maximumPermittedP99 * multiplier

with comments explaining the difference. The multiplier doesn't really say what it does
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: Merge branch 'adjudication_limits' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into adjudication_limits
